layout.p: papyrus codex (7 fol. = 3 bifol.) (columns: 1, written lines: 26, 27, 28, 29, pagination: 20)

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Submit - The text was not appearing in html. I am simply pushing it through once more.
Finalized - This is good to go.
Finalized - This is good to go.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Regularize i.14; in ii.7 Bethlehem has eta in both sides of the |corr|; in iii, renumber the column number to line 1; iii.2 *high-punctus* is a scribal acute; in iii.18 and 19 use *dash* instead of *filler(extension* (also in v.3); in iii.24 it’s chi not xi; in iv.2msup > Ὀχοζει (no braces); regularize in iv.17 instead of using <>; acute (not grave) at end of iv.22; dot the nu at the end of v.1; in v.10 and v.14 I see *high-punctus*; accent πατρὸς in vi.3; add *middot* to end of vi.8; regularize in vii.6 instead of braces; regularize in viii.21 instead of using <>; regularize in viii.24 instead of using braces; regularize in ix.3 instead of using braces and instead of using <>; use *diple* in ix.13 instead of filler(extension) (which belongs only at end of line); regularize in ix.18 instead of using braces; regularize in ix.20 instead of using braces; regularize in ix.22 instead of using <>; regularize in ix.23 instead of using braces; in ix.25 the final μει is not within square brackets; add overstrokes to nomen sacrum in x.1; regularize in x.7 instead of using <>; regularize in x.9 instead of using braces; regularize in x.17 instead of using braces; regularize in x.18 instead of using braces; add overstrokes to nomen sacrum in x.27; use double brackets to mark the scribal deletion in xi.2 (not braces); regularize in xi.9 instead of using <>; the last 4 dots in xi.26 are inside square brackets; regularize in xii.5 instead of using braces; add overstrokes to nomen sacrum in xii.7; add overstrokes to nomen sacrum in xii.9; add overstrokes to nomen sacrum in xii.16; regularize in xii.18 instead of using <>; add lenis to αρεστὸν in xiii.4; regularize in xiii.8 instead of using <>; regularize in xiii.10 instead of using <>; ἵνα in xiii.12 has diairesis, not asper; xiii.22 is lost.?lin instead of .5; regularize in xiv.13 instead of using braces; regularize in xiv.14 instead of using <>; place the period in xiv.18 inside the square brackets; use lost.?lin in xiv.19 instead of [.5] META: Remove volume number from biblio; I’m awaiting biblio # for Geerard (that will be a ‘reference edition’); van Haelst is biblio 8932 (add generic ‘descr.’ to #572) and lots of image links (http://corsair.themorgan.org/vwebv/holdingsInfo?bibId=349915; http://corsair.themorgan.org/vwebv/holdingsInfo?bibId=349918; http://corsair.themorgan.org/vwebv/holdingsInfo?bibId=349926; http://corsair.themorgan.org/vwebv/holdingsInfo?bibId=350196)

Submit - Encoded text and metadata of P.Amherst 1.1 = TM 64754, as part of the Heidelberg Papyrological Webinar, summer 2020. Please check all *high-punctus* and *diastole*!
Submit - Encoded text and metadata of P.Amherst 1.1 = TM 64754, as part of the Heidelberg Papyrological Webinar, summer 2020. Please check all *high-punctus* and *diastole*!

div.p: A corrector has supplied at the top of cols. 3, 4 and 11 some passages omitted by the first scribe. They have to be inserted after the critical sign in respectively col.3 line 17, col.4 line 10 and col.11 line 5. Cols. 13 and 14 are made up from two fragments, of which the smaller, containing the beginnings of lines of col. 13 and the ends of lines of col.14, was obtained after the facsimile has been prepared.

δυνάμου αὐτὸν ἐν
τῇ ἀποστάσει καὶ τῇ

Ἱερουσαλήμ. καὶ ἐπλήθυνεν
ἡ φαρμακείαφαρμακία καὶ ἡ μα

item.p: The scribe has written the final nu of the line as an episema
The scribe has written the final nu of the line as an episema
The ancora after σεν signifies that the omitted passage, supplied at the top of the column, is to be inserted at this point.
The ν αt the end of the line has been inserted later
The ancora after θ(εο)ῦ signifies that the omitted passage, supplied at the top of the column, is to be inserted at this point.
The ι in Βεχειρ has been inserted later
The gamma of Ἀλγασάρ was first omitted by the scribe
The sigma of ἐχμαλωτίσαι was first omitted by the scribe
The sigma of Ἱε[ρου]σαλήμ was first omitted by the scribe
The scribe has written the final nu of the line as an episema
The α of -νται has been inserted later

Τhe nu of τόν was first omitted by the scribe

The scribe has written the final nu of the line as an episema
The rho of σταυρωθῆναι has been inserted later
Papyrus has a lacuna between sigma and kappa, yet, σκανδαλεισθήσονται is written uninterrupted, so probably the scribe found the sheet already damaged
The scribe has written the final nu of the line as an episema
There are some traces of ink after προφητει, probably a word erased
ιζ rewritten
Over the letters εστα of the second ἔσται, there are dots, which signify that the word was to be erased
The ancora after αὐτ[ό]ν signifies that the omitted passage, supplied at the the top of the column, is to be inserted at this point.
Over the epsilon of (πίστ{ε}ιν), there is a dot, which signifies that it was to be erased
The scribe has written the final nu of the line as an episema
-τος, i.e. [στερεώμα]τος
